page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: There are {two distinct regions within the block:-{city}and{village.} Within the city region housing is a mixture of both period and style. The{ {oldest building}is the medieval Tythe Barn (Hallgarth St). There are also examples of {Tudor}(Owengate),{ {Georgian}(N. Bailey, Market Place),{ {Victorian/Edwardian}(The Avenue) and modern housing (Archery Rise). Styles range from terraced (some divided into flats), semis and detached. The terrain has influenced the layout of this housing which is mainly built of brick. Slate roofs are predominant on old housing while tiles are seen on modern homes. Villages have a nucleus of small, terraced miners' homes around which more modern semis, terraces and council houses have been built.
